page.title: 02Schools in Banbury
page.content: There are a lot of primary schools in Banbury for children from five to eleven years old. There is Dashwood, St.Mary's, St.John's, St.Leonard's, St.Joseph's, The Grange, Hillview, Harriers' Ground, William Morris, Neithrop, Queensway and Hardwick. Older children go to secondary school. The one we will go to is called Banbury School. It has three halls - Wykham, Stanbridge and Broughton. There is another secondary school called Drayton and one called Blessed George Napier. Some teenagers go to the technical college when they are about sixteen. There are also some nursery schools and playgroups for little children before they start going to a proper school. People pay to send children to these.
